title.narrative: ADEQUATE SOCIAL TRANSFERS

description.narrative: Social services are adequately planned, delivered, financed and monitored to reach the most marginalized children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end of 2020, an increased number of girls, boys and their families benefit from integrated and child-sensitive social protection services and transfers that address poverty, deprivation and social exclusion.

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
